title: What happens if Apple buys Disney? - Quora

response.answer_text: Then we’d live in a very different world than we live in currently. Disney has a market cap of 230B with able 23B cash on hold, neither are anything to sneeze at. However Apple is entirely different beast, with a market cap over 2T (trillion) and cash on hand of just under 200B. If you would have reversed the question it would have been something discuss but there is no way in the world we currently live in that Disney could buy Apple, at best they could spend all their cash and buy a little over a percent and would still be 6% behind Vanguard for the largest institutional investor, but at least they’d be ahead of the chairmen of Apple’s board.

It will also likely need to take on additional debt to close the deal, which would boost its current liabilities of $102.2 billion. Buying Disney in its entirety would boost Apple's annual revenue by nearly 30%. As a percentage of the combined company's 2019 revenue, Apple's iPhone sales would drop from 55% to 43%.
